curam.util.resources

Interface EnvironmentConstants.Database

  • Enclosing interface:
    EnvironmentConstants

    public static interface EnvironmentConstants.Database
    These settings configure Curam for database communication.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      • kDatabaseTypeProperty

        static final java.lang.String kDatabaseTypeProperty
        The property which specifies the database type. Suggested: DB2/ORA/ZOS. Property name : curam.db.type
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kPasswordProperty

        static final java.lang.String kPasswordProperty
        The encrypted password that corresponds to the user name specified above. The database password is never stored in plaintext in the various Curam property files. Property name : curam.db.password
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kUsernameProperty

        static final java.lang.String kUsernameProperty
        A valid database username. Property name : curam.db.username
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleCacheSize

        static final java.lang.String kOracleCacheSize
        The size of the prepared statement cache used by batch programs when run against Oracle (the prepared statement cache is based around implicit caching). Property name : curam.db.oracle.cachesize
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleConnectionCacheEnabled

        static final java.lang.String kOracleConnectionCacheEnabled
        Turn on connection caching for Oracle outside of an Application Server. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.enabled
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleConnectionCacheMinLimit

        static final java.lang.String kOracleConnectionCacheMinLimit
        Set Min Limit for the Cache. This sets the minimum number of PooledConnections that the cache maintains. This guarantees that the cache will not shrink below this minimum limit. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.minlimit
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleConnectionCacheMaxLimit

        static final java.lang.String kOracleConnectionCacheMaxLimit
        Set Max Limit for the Cache. This sets the maximum number of PooledConnections the cache can hold. There is no default MaxLimit assumed meaning connections in the cache could reach as many as the database allows. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.maxlimit
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleConnectionCacheInitialLimit

        static final java.lang.String kOracleConnectionCacheInitialLimit
        Set the Initial Limit. This sets the size of the connection cache when the cache is initially created or reinitialized. When this property is set to a value greater than 0, then that number of connections are pre-created and are ready for use. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.initiallimit
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleConnectionCacheName

        static final java.lang.String kOracleConnectionCacheName
        The name used to identify the cache uniquely. Property name : curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.name
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kTablespaceNameOnZOS

        static final java.lang.String kTablespaceNameOnZOS
        Property which specifies the name of the table space used for 32k storage on DB2 z/OS. Property name : curam.db.zos.32ktablespace
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kEnableForeignKeysOnZOS

        static final java.lang.String kEnableForeignKeysOnZOS
        Controls whether foreign keys are generated for a z/OS database when running the Data Manager. Note on usage - If Foreign Keys are used against a z/OS database, the tables are put in a CHECK_PENDING state, causing failures when the tables are accessed. The state can only be changed through direct DBA intervention on the target platform (hence it cannot be scripted into the Data Manager which can run on remote clients). In normal usage the Data Manager invokes LOB Manager after applying the foreign keys. This means the LOB manager should be re-run after the this CHECK_PENDING state has been resolved. Property name : curam.db.zos.enableforeignkeys
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDisableForeignKeys

        static final java.lang.String kDisableForeignKeys
        Controls whether foreign keys are generated in SQL statements. By default this property is false, which means foreign key generation is enabled. However, for z/OS foreign keys will not be generated if curam.db.zos.enableforeignkeys is set to false. Property name : curam.db.disableforeignkeys
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDisableInvalidLobFileError

        static final java.lang.String kDisableInvalidLobFileError
        This property controls the reporting of invalid LOB file paths in DMX files. The default value is FALSE. By default a build exception will be thrown, when set to TRUE a warning will be reported. Property name : curam.db.disableInvalidLobFileError
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDatabaseEncodingOnZOS

        static final java.lang.String kDatabaseEncodingOnZOS
        Property which specifies whether the database being used on z/OS requires processing for EBCDIC, ASCII, or UNICODE encoding. This should be set to EBCDIC, ASCII, or UNICODE depending on the appropriate database encoding in use. EBCDIC is the default value. Property name : curam.db.zos.encoding
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDatabaseNameOnZOS

        static final java.lang.String kDatabaseNameOnZOS
        The name of the database on z/OS. Property name : curam.db.zos.dbname
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDatabaseShortNamesRequired

        static final java.lang.String kDatabaseShortNamesRequired
        It is strongly recommended that this property be set to false. The functionality for this property is planned for removal in a future version of Curam. If you have utilized this property in previous versions of Curam please contact Curam Support for more information. Property name : curam.database.shortnames
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOracleDatabaseServiceName

        static final java.lang.String kOracleDatabaseServiceName
        The Oracle database service name. Setting this will create database connection using Oracle service name. Property name : curam.db.oracle.servicename
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDatabaseName

        static final java.lang.String kDatabaseName
        The database name. This setting will be overridden if property "curam.db.oracle.servicename" is set for Oracle database. Property name : curam.db.name
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kServerName

        static final java.lang.String kServerName
        The database server name. Property name : curam.db.servername
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kServerPort

        static final java.lang.String kServerPort
        Suggested: 1521 (Oracle)/ 50000 (DB2). The database server TCP/IP port. Property name : curam.db.serverport
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kEnableBindingsGeneration

        static final java.lang.String kEnableBindingsGeneration
        Suggested: false. Causes a bindings file to be generated for the JDBC data source when a database connection is made outside of the application server, e.g. by the Batch Launcher. Has no effect if property 'curam.db.disable.bindings.generation' is set. Intended to be used to produce a starter bindings file which can then be customized. Property name : curam.db.enable.bindings.generation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kOverrideDefaultBindings

        static final java.lang.String kOverrideDefaultBindings
        Suggested: false. Prevents re-generation of the JDBC data source bindings file and instead causes the data source to be looked up from a customized bindings file when a database connection is made outside of the application server, e.g. by the Batch Launcher. Property name : curam.db.disable.bindings.generation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDmxLocale

        static final java.lang.String kDmxLocale
        Default: en. Property that specifies the locale that will be used when inserting dmx data onto the database. The locale should be specified in the format: language_country, for example en_US. Property name : curam.dmx.locale
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDbMultibyteExpansion

        static final java.lang.String kDbMultibyteExpansion
        Enables the multi-byte expansion feature. Default value is true. Property name : curam.db.multibyte.expansion
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDbMultibyteDefaultFactor

        static final java.lang.String kDbMultibyteDefaultFactor
        Specifies the default expansion factor for multi byte string fields if multi byte expansion is enabled. Must be a float between the values of 1 and 4. Default value is 4. Property name : curam.db.multibyte.default.factor
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDb2Purescale

        static final java.lang.String kDb2Purescale
        Default: false. Indicates that the DB2 pureScale property, enableSysplexWLB, will be set for the DB2 DataSource and WebSphere configuration. Property name : curam.db2.purescale
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDb2Ssl

        static final java.lang.String kDb2Ssl
        Default: false. Indicates that SSL is to be used for DB2 database communications." Property name : curam.db2.ssl
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDb2SslTrustStoreLocation

        static final java.lang.String kDb2SslTrustStoreLocation
        Specifies the SSL trust store location to be used for secure DB2 database communications. Default: null." Property name : curam.db2.ssl.truststore.location
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kDb2SslTrustStorePassword

        static final java.lang.String kDb2SslTrustStorePassword
        Specifies the SSL trust store password to be used for secure DB2 database communications. Default: null." Property name : curam.db2.ssl.truststore.password
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kZOSBigInt

        static final java.lang.String kZOSBigInt
        Default: true. Indicates that DB2 for z/OS should use BIGINT instead of VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA (legacy). Property name : curam.db.zos.usebigint
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kReadMultiMaxOptionName

        static final java.lang.String kReadMultiMaxOptionName
        Default: 100. Allows the developer to override the default maximum number of records returned by the readmulti (readmulti, nsreadmulti, nkreadmulti and nsmulti) operations in an application. This default value is only used if an explicit value is not set in the model. Property name : curam.db.readmultimax
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kLockTimeOut

        static final java.lang.String kLockTimeOut
        Default: 30. Allows the developer to set the lock timeout in seconds on an Oracle database when performing a singleton select FOR UPDATE. The syntax here is to append a WAIT XX clause to the statement. This default value is only used if an explicit value is not set. Property name : curam.db.locktimeout
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kBatchSizeLimit

        static final java.lang.String kBatchSizeLimit
        Default: 10. Globally defines the number of updates that can be grouped together as part of a batch update. Property name : curam.db.batch.limit
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
